titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The embryologist and historian of science Jane M. Oppenheimer (1911-1996) was a graduate and long term member of the faculty at Bryn Mawr College. Her research centered on the early development of the killifish Fundulus heteroclitus and on the history of embryology.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Jane Oppenheimer. Included are correspondence, reports, and newspaper clippings related to NASA experiments, drafts of articles, lecture notes on Von Baer, course grade books, and awards and certificates. The collection also contains various reprints, including a two volume bound set of Oppenheimer's writings (1934-1963).

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: American Philosophical Society: Jane M. Oppenheimer papers.
